Please answer TRUE, FALSE or UNKNOWABLE about the text's veracity. In addition write a short summary explaining your answer. If the veracity cannot be determined answer UNKNOWABLE. The first sentence in the response should be TRUE. FALSE. or UNKNOWABLE. eg:UNKNOWABLE.

Determine whether the statement is TRUE or FALSE based on the content and a number of short explanations with additional information. Only one of the following explanations is relevant: SECTION A:

By the term "pre-election", Pirates Chairman Bartoš probably means the 2017 post-election strategy , which the Pirates published before the 2017 elections to the Chamber of Deputies, the introduction of which states:

"We will negotiate with all other political parties. Our support for any government is conditional on the fact that incompetent people or people with a history of corruption are not nominated to the government. In no case will we support a government with the participation of entities threatening the foundations of liberal democracy or with a historical legacy of the liquidation of democracy in this country, i.e. in particular with the participation of the KSČM, SPD or a predominance of ANO." The post-election strategy further states: "We will demand reasonable guarantees to prevent abuse of power, for example, we will refuse to support candidates who would be in a constant conflict of interest."

The Pirates therefore really condition their support for the government on the democracy of their potential coalition partners. According to the cited post-election strategy, the Pirates reject cooperation with the SPD and the KSČM. Ivan Bartoš further states the refusal to support a government in which the ANO movement will have a majority, which is also in line with the cited part of the strategy. According to the cited post-election strategy, Bartoš also states a corrupt past and a conflict of interest as an obstacle to possible support for the government.

There is also a pirate post-election strategy for the 2019 European Parliament elections, which is in line with the previously cited document. It states:

" We want our program priorities and personnel requirements for the Commissioners to be reflected in the negotiations. European Commissioners must be competent people, without corruption scandals and ties to lobbyists of large corporations. (...) We therefore refuse to participate in the formation of a political group with undemocratic parties or parties that do not respect human rights or are fundamentally against the existence of the European Union as such."

SECTION B:

Jakub Michálek faced an unsuccessful attempt to dismiss him from the position of First Vice-Chairman of the Pirates at the turn of October and November 2019. In November 2019, he announced that he would not defend his position as Vice-Chairman and would continue to work in the Chamber of Deputies. He has been the chairman of the Pirates parliamentary group since October 2017. He commented on his dismissal on the Pirates forum in a post dated October 24, 2019, as follows:

"I said some time ago that I would not run again, that I want to fully concentrate on leading the club and leave the work in the republican presidency to someone else who has fresh enthusiasm to move things forward. We have a lot of new, talented representatives and I want to take a break, finish my dissertation and devote more time to my loved ones."

MP Michálek then actually on January 7, 2020 defended the post of chairman of the Pirates parliamentary group in the Chamber of Deputies.

We assess the statement as true, as Michálek's post on the pirate forum confirms the words of MP Bartoš that Michálek had proclaimed his intention not to defend the post of party vice-chairman even before the case of his dismissal. However, we were unable to find out from public sources whether this was actually the case in the summer of 2019.

SECTION C:

Jindřich Šídlo actually used the phrase "toddlers with flamethrowers" in his show Happy Monday on September 30, 2019. Specifically, at 5 minutes and 32 seconds. The entire sentence reads: " These are the Pirates, or as we, traditional voters, toddlers with flamethrowers, who may soon rule us." He used this sentence after describing the internal party vote on performers at a pre-election rally before the 2019 EP elections. The vote was on whether the leader of the candidate, Marcel Kolaja, or a pony, would speak at the rally. The pony won .

The phrase was not repeated literally by the reporter of the Seznam Zprávy server, Václav Dolejší, specifically saying "with workers with flamethrowers". In his article, he describes his view of the national pirate forum, which took place between January 11 and 12, 2020. He also describes, from his perspective, the coming of age of the party, the Pirate Party's plans for the next elections, and also the vote to dissolve the party, which is allegedly an exaggeration (time 1:31) and takes place every year.

The words "toddlers" and "toddlers" are different, but they share a common context.

However, the phrase "toddlers with flamethrowers" has been used several times in history. Specifically, in the program 168 hodin (time 8:00) broadcast on October 27, 2019, Václav Dolejší stated that he had read the term on Twitter . Before the broadcast, the term was mentioned on Twitter three times. On September 30, 2019, which could have been related to Jindřich Šídl's program. However, the absolute first traced mention of this term dates back to September 29, 2017, when Petr Honzejk mentioned it in Hospodářské noviny , saying that he found it on Josef Bouška's Facebook profile . We went through the posts, but we did not find the mention. However, the post may have been deleted.

Although the term "toddlers with flamethrowers" appeared before Jindřich Šídlo used it, he undoubtedly contributed significantly to its popularization, and we therefore assess the statement as true.

SECTION D:

Pirate Party National Election Team consists of an election committee and an election coordinator. The functioning of the election committee is regulated by Section 15c of the Election Code. The election committee currently has 6 people and its chairman is Senator Lukáš Wagenknecht . He was unanimously elected to the position by the members of the election committee at an introductory meeting held on July 19, 2019.

Other members include Karolína Sadílková (representative of the media department), Helena Vondráková (coordinator of the Liberec region and representative of the personnel department), Petr Fojtík , Kamil Kubica and Aleš Krupa . The election coordinator is Pavel Štěpánek .

The main tasks of the election committee include approving the overall strategy and financing of the election campaign and coordinating the election staff. We therefore assess the statement as true.

SECTION E:

Ivan Bartoš talks here about the so-called "prison" bus , which the Pirates used as part of their election campaign in the 2017 elections to the Chamber of Deputies. It also appeared in their election spot .

Source: iDnes.cz

On the side of the bus are caricatures of some top politicians, drawing attention to well-known cases. Among those depicted are indeed people from the ČSSD. Specifically, these are Bohuslav Sobotka, who is connected to the OKD case , and David Rath, who was finally convicted of corruption in 2019 after seven years of detention.

The last sentence of the statement speaks of Miroslav Kalousek , who served as Minister of Finance in the second government of Mirek Topolánek for the KDU-ČSL and then again in the government of Petr Nečas, this time for TOP 09.

Other politicians depicted on the side of the bus are Andrej Babiš and Jana Nečasová (Nagyová).

SECTION F:

Lukáš Wagenknecht is truly an expert in the fight against corruption. For his work, for example, in 2015 he received the Courage Award from the Anti-Corruption Foundation.

Wagenknecht was the first deputy at the Ministry of Finance from February2014 , when Andrej Babiš was the Minister of Finance. He dismissed him after a year and a quarter, although he also offered him the position of political deputy, which Wagenknecht did not accept.

In his statement, Ivan Bartoš is apparently referring to the conflict between Lukáš Wagenknecht and Andrej Babiš regarding the non-transparent tender procedure for the IT system prepared by the Ministry of Regional Development. This case ultimately led to the suspension of the disbursement of subsidies in the amount of 568 million crowns. However, we will not assess the real reasons for Wagenknecht's dismissal, because we understandably do not know the real motivation of Prime Minister Babiš.

In 2018, Lukáš Wagenknecht was actually elected senator for the Pirates.

Respond only with either TRUE or FALSE and the correct section name, examples: TRUE, SECTION A.
